SOURCE: Washington Post; Finance & Commerce; Park Rapids Enterprise; Committee to Protect Journalists; Minnesota Public Radio; KIMT3; Channel 5 (Twin Cities); CNN; Wisconsin Public Radio; SouthernMinn.com; KBJR6; KEYC News Now; MinnPost; AP; New York Times; Unicorn Riot; Twitter; St. Paul Pioneer Press; Star Tribune (Minneapolis); Brainerd Dispatch; Bemidji Pioneer; Detroit News; Bring Me The News; Local 4 (Detroit)
NOTES: On 7 June 2021, hundreds of people led by Indigenous women blockaded roads with a boat and other materials and locked themselves to pipeline equipment near a pumping station in Two Inlets (Minnesota) to demonstrate against the construction of the Enbridge Line 3 pipeline, to stand against its negative impacts on the environment, to show support for Native American land treaties, and to urge President Biden to halt construction. Actresses Jane Fonda and Taylor Schilling were also in attendance to raise awareness and to stand against the pipeline project. Around Noon, a law enforcement helicopter arrived at the blockade and gave dispersal orders before flying over the demonstrators and kicking up dirt and dust. Later, a large contingent of police officers intervened and arrested about 250 demonstrators for trespassing and unlawful assembly. Police officers also arrested, detained, strip-searched and confiscated the belongings of journalist Alan Weisman who was wearing press lanyards and was on assignment for the Los Angeles Times. The Enbridge company released a statement reporting that demonstrators also damaged some of their equipment and property during the event, publishing images of vehicles with slashed tires while claiming demonstrators cut hoses, put dirt in engines, and destroyed electrical wiring equipment. [size=hundreds]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Antifa (United States); Civilians (United States); Journalists (United States)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
SOURCE: Fox12 Oregon; Portland Police Department; KOIN6; Portland Mercury; Twitter; Oregonian; KATU; US Press Freedom Tracker
NOTES: On 24 June 2021, about 50 people, some carrying anti-fascist signs and flags, gathered outside a Motel 6 near the Oregon Convention Center in Portland-Northeast (Oregon) to condemn police actions after there were reports on social media that the Portland Police Bureau shot an unarmed person of color while responding to a mental health emergency call. Later reports state that the victim was white and was carrying a screwdriver as he walked towards officers. Roughly 15-20 police officers responded to the demonstration by forming a 'riot line' while wearing helmets and carrying less-lethal guns. Video footage shows one officer pushing a demonstrator who then seems to grab the officer's baton. Officers then fired mace and rubber bullets at demonstrators. Some of the demonstrators threw water bottles at police in response. A journalist reported a police officer hitting him with a baton and damaging his equipment. [size=about 50]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: LGBT (United States); Antifa (United States); Civilians (United States); Journalists (United States)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: QAnon; Christian Group (United States); Proud Boys; Central Valley Militia; Save Our Children
SOURCE: Slate; Washington Post; KTLA5; KTVU Fox2; Twitter; It's Going Down
NOTES: On 3 July 2021, people rallied outside Wi Spa in Los Angeles-Central (California) against a transgender woman allegedly undressing in the women's changing area. Demonstrators rallied in support of the QAnon-linked Save Our Children movement, former President Trump, and QAnon. Members of the Proud Boys, affiliates of the Central Valley Militia, and adherents to Christianity attended. Dozens of counter demonstrators including members of Antifa also gathered and staged a 'No Bigotry in L.A.' rally to show support for transgender people. Physical altercations ensued which left at least five people injured, including one journalist. At least one person at the event was carrying a gun. One member of the Proud Boys allegedly threatened a police officer with a baseball bat. Officers separated the groups and fired at least one less-lethal round at pro-trans demonstrators while allegedly beating them with batons. Police and others claim that the locker room incident was staged. However, several transgender women also allegedly received death threats after the Wi Spa incident. [size=dozens] [counter-demonstration] [armed]

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Antifa (United States); Civilians (United States); Journalists (United States)
SOURCE: Oregonian; Twitter; Network Contagion Research Institute; KOIN6
NOTES: On 13 July 2021, about 50 to 70 people, including Christians, gathered for a 'Church at Planned Parenthood' demonstration outside a Planned Parenthood in Salem (Oregon) to stand against abortion and to conduct a 'worship service outside the gates of Hell.' Armed members of Proud Boys were in attendance as 'security' and participated in the event. About 40 counter demonstrators, allegedly including members of Antifa, also gathered with 'bats, paintball guns and armor.' The two groups clashed and used chemical irritants against one another. After the deployment of chemical irritants, police officers used crowd control munitions to separate the two groups. One member of the Proud Boys allegedly attacked a journalist. Two people were arrested. [size=about 50 to 70] [counter-demonstration] [armed]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: LGBT (United States); Antifa (United States); Civilians (United States); Journalists (United States); Health Workers (United States)
ACTOR2: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: QAnon; Save Our Children; Proud Boys; Groypers; Civilians (United States); Journalists (United States)
SOURCE: Los Angeles Times; MilitiaWatch; Channel 3 (Santa Barbara); Twitter; It's Going Down; Intercept; Network Contagion Research Institute
NOTES: On 17 July 2021, about 50-80 people rallied and marched for a second week to the Wi Spa in Los Angeles-Central (California) to stand against an alleged incident in which a transgender woman undressed in the women's dressing room and against transgender people in general. Proud Boys armed with baseball bats, Mass Resistance, QAnon supporters, supporters of the QAnon-linked 'Save Our Children' movement, Groypers, and Trump supporters attended. Counter demonstrators, including transgender people and members of Antifa, were also present and rallied in support of transgender people. The groups engaged in physical altercations that allegedly included throwing smoke bombs and other objects at officers and demonstrators throwing water bottles at each other. Officers in riot gear hit pro-LGBT demonstrators with batons and fired bean bag rounds, in an alleged excessive use of force against pro-transgender demonstrators. (Officers use of less lethal projectiles comes during an active federal restriction on LAPD's use of projectile launchers against crowds unless they 'pose a clear threat of serious bodily harm to others.') At least one officer shot a less-lethal round at a fleeing demonstrator. 38 to 40 pro-transgender supporters were arrested after officers attempted to kettle the demonstrators. Officers confiscated stun guns, knives, and pepper spray. Some demonstrators were allegedly injured by police. At least two journalists were allegedly physically assaulted by anti-transgender demonstrators. Additionally, one journalist was assaulted by pro-transgender demonstrators, one civilian was maced by a Proud Boy, and a medic was attacked by a group of Proud Boys. There were no reported arrests among right-wing demonstrators. [size=about 50-80]

SOURCE: US Press Freedom Tracker; Twitter; Network Contagion Research Institute; MilitiaWatch
NOTES: On 22 July 2021, anti-mask demonstrators including members of the Proud Boys demonstrated in front of a cancer treatment center in West Hollywood (California) against vaccines, masks, and other public health measures related to the coronavirus pandemic. Counter demonstrators were also present. Members of the Proud Boys physically attacked both counter demonstrators and civilians, attacking one cancer patient. One journalist was allegedly shoved and sprayed with bear mace by a person rallying against coronavirus restrictions. [size=no report] [counter-demonstration]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Proud Boys; Christian Group (United States); Unidentified Communal Militia (United States)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Antifa (United States); Civilians (United States); Journalists (United States)
NOTES: On 8 August 2021, far-right activists including Proud Boys and Christian nationalists gathered in Portland-Downtown (Oregon) for a claimed 'prayer' event that quickly devolved into open fights against left-wing counter-demonstrators, the throwing of improvised explosive devices, and a man walking around downtown Portland with an airsoft rifle designed to look real that he pointed at counter demonstrators and journalists. Proud Boys and Christian groups targeted journalists and antifascist adversaries. The police did not initially charge the man walking around with the airsoft rifle. [size=no report] [counter-demonstration]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Proud Boys; Back the Blue; Pro-Police Group (United States)
SOURCE: Spectrum News 1 (Southern California); Los Angeles Times; Deadline; Guardian (United Kingdom)
NOTES: On 14 August 2021, several hundred people including Proud Boys staged a 'medical freedom' rally near City Hall in Los Angeles-Central (California) against coronavirus vaccine and mask mandates. Some demonstrators wore apparel supporting former President Donald Trump and some demonstrators also rallied in support of the Back the Blue movement and law enforcement. A few dozen counter-demonstrators staged a 'No Safe Space For Fascists' rally in support of mandatory coronavirus vaccines. A physical altercation broke out between the two groups. Two people were stabbed, one with the larger group who was hospitalized with 'a lacerated heart and punctured lung' and other who sustained less serious wounds. Two journalists were physically assaulted by 'medical freedom' demonstrators including Proud Boys. One antifa demonstrator was arrested for stabbing demonstrators. [size=several hundred] [counter-demonstration]

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Antifa (United States); Civilians (United States); Journalists (United States); Interfaith Group (United States); BLM: Black Lives Matter; Christian Group (United States)
NOTES: On 22 August 2021, far-right demonstrators gathered in Portland-Downtown (Oregon) for an event called the 'Summer of Love', against vaccines amid the coronavirus, and in support of freeing alleged political prisoners captured by law enforcement during the January 6 Capitol riot. The demonstration started in Portland-Northeast and quickly devolved into a violent riot as they made their way downtown. Proud Boys and Three Percenter adherents, many of them wielding paintball guns and crude weapons, fought with counter-demonstrators, which included antifascists, an interfaith group, and people supporting Black Lives Matter, injuring multiple people. Members of Proud Boys and other far-right groups also attacked journalists and a clergyman and destroyed several vehicles as they marched around the city. One far-right demonstrator opened fire on a group of interfaith, antifa, and Black Lives Matter demonstrators in the downtown area with a handgun, with some demonstrators reportedly returning fire with live rounds. No one was injured in the exchange and the far right demonstrator was arrested. [size=no report] [counter-demonstration] [armed]

On 26 August 2021, 80-100 people demonstrated in Traverse City (Michigan) against mask mandates amid the coronavirus pandemic. An organizer of the event pointed out a reporter and asked men at the demonstration to prevent him from recording the event. Two men then confronted the reporter and one man shoved the reporter then began punching him. [size=80-100]

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Antifa (United States); Journalists (United States); Civilians (United States)
SOURCE: MilitiaWatch; Network Contagion Research Institute; Olympian; Fox News; King5; KOMO4; Forest Grove News-Times
NOTES: On 4 September 2021, people including members of the Proud Boys gathered near the State Capitol in Olympia (Washington) to demonstrate against coronavirus vaccine mandates. Members of Antifa were also present to demonstrate against the right wing group. The groups engaged in verbal and physical altercations, a group of Proud Boys began chasing Antifa members. One masked individual, presumably a member of Antifa, fired five shots from a handgun, one of which hit a prominent member of the Portland Proud Boys in the foot. The gunman has not yet been identified. Police intervened to separate the two groups, although it is not clear if arrests were made. A female journalist aligned with the anti-fascist movement was also physically attacked and maced by Proud Boy members earlier in the day. [size=no report] [counter-demonstration] [armed]

On 22 September 2021, people attacked a Bangladeshi journalist at a press conference hosted by US-based members of the Awami League in New York - Queens (New York). The journalist began asking questions when individuals rushed and grabbed at the journalist. Several journalists tried to protect the targeted journalist. The journalist reported his assault to the NYPD and was treated for his injuries. [size=no report]

ACTOR2: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
NOTES: On 19 November 2021, about 200 people gathered for a demonstration at Southwest Main Street near Southwest 2nd Avenue, in Portland-Downtown (Oregon), against the acquittal of Kyle Rittenhouse, who killed two people and injured another in Wisconsin during a demonstration in support of the Black Lives Matter movement and against the shooting of Jacob Blake in 2020. Demonstrators stood in the street and blocked traffic, chanting anti-police slogans. The demonstration was declared a riot by the Multnomah County Sheriff's Office when the demonstrators damaged the gate to the Multnomah County Detention Center. Demonstrators broke windows, and threw objects at police, which according to police included batteries, water bottles, urine, and alcoholic beverages. Demonstrators also set fire to trash and debris in the street and broke windows on a police car. Police criminally cited five people and gave 17 warnings, though they did not use tear gas, and there were no claims of injuries. Police also made one arrest for an outstanding warrant unrelated to the demonstration. A group of approximately seven individuals from the demonstration, including at least one in black bloc, instructed at least two members of the KATU News crew to 'stop filming' the demonstration - after this, a scuffle took place in which the news crew's camera was damaged, though the journalists themselves were not injured. [size=about 200]
In the hometown of journalist Norbert Zongo, who was killed in 12/98, riots broke out. Rioters torched buildings and cars. Police responded.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: ANEB: National Association of Burkinabe Students; Journalists (Burkina Faso)
NOTES: Authorities have used tear gas to disperse thousands of students marching in Burkina Faso after the death of a young man in police custody. Witnesses said there were injuries Friday, and national television reporters were beaten and their cameras taken away by demonstrators. Smoke rose from burning tires at the scene. ANEB organized the demo.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Save Burkina Faso; Civilians (Burkina Faso); Journalists (Burkina Faso)
ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie; Civilians (Burkina Faso); Government of Burkina Faso (2015-); MPP: People's Movement for Progress
SOURCE: Le Faso; Infowakat; BF1 TV; Sidwaya; Burkina24; RFI; Jeune Afrique; MinuteBf; Undisclosed Source; Actu Burkina; Gulmu Info; AFP
NOTES: On 27 November 2021, thousands of people, including the Save Burkina Faso movement, demonstrated in the capital of Ouagadougou (Ouagadougou, Kadiogo). The demonstrators expressed support for the defense and security forces and called for the resignation of president Kabore. The demonstrators barricaded roads, burned tires, vandalized the Directorate of Population and Civil Status, the central town hall, and the ruling MPP party headquarters, and threw stones at police and gendarmes who intervened by firing tear gas to disperse the demonstrators. About ten people including two journalists and a child were wounded and several demonstrators arrested. [size=thousands]

On 18 February 2020, about 3 rioters, who own a local liquor and grocery store, attacked an Uzbek blogger near the Holid Ibn Walid mosque in Asaka town of Andizhan region of Uzbekistan after blogger criticized them online over selling alcohol near the mosque. [size=about 3]

On 7 October 2020, a group of rioters physically attacked and assaulted an Uzbek journalist near the town of Chirchiq in Tashkent region after the victim started recording attackers in the process of cutting trees. [size=no report]

On 17 March 2021, journalists of Effect.uz news hub were assaulted by employees and medics of the narcological dispensary at the medical facility in Fergana city following Effect.uz report on a tasing incident at the dispensary days earlier. Around 16 March 2021, a male medic of the narcological dispensary used an electric taser on a male patient who was undergoing alcohol detox at the facility. Police were called in to the scene. [size=no report]

On 26 May 2021, about 20 rioters attempted to disrupt a meeting between Erk opposition party leader Jahongir Otajonov and his supporters at Otajonov's residence near Yunusabad locality in Tashkent city during which intruders physically assaulted a photographer and damaged his recording equipment. [size=about 20]

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: PSUV: United Socialist Party of Venezuela
NOTES: On 2 April 2018, a group of supporters of the government attacked the participants of a political campaign rally led by the candidate of the political party Progressive Advance, Henri Falcon. One member of the candidate's political team and a journalist were seriously injured.

On 5 May 2018, in Merida, Merida, a group of supporters of the presidential candidate Henri Falcon were participating in a campaign rally when a group of supporters of the government confronted them. In the confrontations, one journalist was injured. [size=no report]

On 15 May 2018, the National Guard blocked the entrance of the Parliament to journalists that were going to report the legislative sessions. The blockage generated confrontations between the journalists and the National Guard who destroyed cameras and other press materials.

On 7 September 2018, the Venezuelan National Syndicate of the Press claimed that journalists of El Informador were beaten and detained in the Market of Barquisimeto in the state of Lara. Traders locked up journalists inside the market when they were doing research work. The motives are unknown.

ASSOC_ACTOR_1: Civilians (Venezuela); Journalists (Venezuela); VP: Popular Will; Government of Venezuela (1999-) National Assembly
SOURCE: El Nacional (Venezuela); OVCS: Observatorio Venezolano de Conflictividad Social
NOTES: On January 23, 2019, on the Panteon Avenue in El Panteon, Distrito Federal, during a looting, one person was shot dead by security forces. More than five commercial establishments were looted on San Martin Avenue, San Juan Parish, when residents of the sector decided to take to the streets and make barricades. The demonstration followed the call made by the president of the National Assembly and opposition leader, Juan Guaido, against the regime of President Nicolas Maduro. Security forces repressed the group of demonstrators with tear gas. During the night, the Bolivarian National Guard tried to disperse the demonstrators with strong detonations. The Bolivarian National Guard also fired at journalists while they were covering the demonstrations that were taking place in the area. One fatality recorded. [size=no report]

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On Jan 23, in Guanare, Portuguesa state, people mobilized to demonstrate against Nicolas Maduro's regime. The march was called by the president of the National Assembly. The march ended with the confrontation of demonstrators and officials of the police and the National Bolivarian Guard. A journalist was injured when he was covering the mobilization

On 23 May 2019, in Guarico, renal patients and their relatives held a protest and peacefully overtook the dialysis room at the Zamora Arevalo Hospital, with the intention of drawing attention of the health authorities to obtain the endowment of 16 hemodialysis and osmosis machine that they need to the new dialysis room. Furthermore, during the event, a journalist of a local newspaper who was covering the event was attacked by a worker from the hospital. The protesters had to intervene in order to prevent the attack. [size=no report]

NOTES: On February 11, 2020, at the international airport Simon Bolivar in Maiquetia, Vargas state, a group of workers from the national airline Conviasa and supporters of the regime of President Nicolas Maduro attacked a group of journalist that were covering the arrival of the opposition leader Juan Guaido. Guaido arrived in Venezuela after an international tour to Europe and North America. Guaido and his wife, as well as journalists and deputies, were attacked. Ten journalists were injured and Guaido's uncle was arrested by security forces without a motive. [size=no report]

On March 3, 2020, in Barcelona, Anzoategui state, a group of health workers from the Luis Razetti hospital clashed with a journalist. The journalist accused some nurses, that were demonstrating in front of the hospital, of stealing medicines. The demonstration ended up with clashes and people beating each other. No injuries were reported. [size=no report]

ASSOC_ACTOR_2: Military Forces of Venezuela (1999-) GNB: Venezuelan National Guard
NOTES: On 5 June 2020, in Valle de La Pascua, Infante municipality, Guarico state, a group of people burned tires on a street due to the lack of fuel. A journalist was arrested by police officers and National Guard (GNB) officers for recording the demonstration. Various demonstrations have taken place in the country after more than 1 million barrels of gasoline arrived from Iran but they have not been able to cover the internal demand. [size=no report]

On 16 August 2020, in Maiquetia, Vargas state, a group of people clashed with state police forces during and eviction from the Brisas de Maiquetia community. Two journalists were beaten and threatened during the clash. [size=no report]

NOTES: On 13 October 2020, in Merida (Merida state), residents demonstrated in sectors such as La Parroquia and La Pedregosa to reject the lack of basic public services and petrol. CPNB and GNB officers arrived at the site to disperse demonstrators, eventually clashing with the latter and intimidating journalists. Neither injuries nor arrests were reported. [size=no report]

SOURCE: La Verdad de Vargas; El Nacional (Venezuela)
NOTES: Around 25 October 2020 (as reported), in Playa Grande (Sucre state), a group of pro-government journalists, together with police officials, sabotaged a Popular Will political rally led by Juan Guaido. ASSOC_ACTOR_1: UPND: United Party for National Development; Journalists (Zambia)
NOTES: After planned UPND rally was cancelled due to PF protests, UPND members rioted, marched through Rhodespark and Church Road in Lusaka to Kamwala, harassing motorists and attacking traffic police officers. Rioters reportedly used different types of missiles. Police used tear gas, rubber bullets, and and live ammunition. 1 girl killed, 1 man wounded. 22 arrested several, including a journalist.

PF supporters besieged the offices of radio station 5FM, where an NDC politician was giving an interview. They broke windows and destroyed vehicles, before they were chased away by NDC supporters, who shot guns in the air to deter the rioters.

On October 12th, a mob attacked journalists covering a trial involving a local businessman (who is also a head of department in a college) in Kitwe (Copperbelt). The attackers are believed to be supporters of the businessman, who is accused (along with one other man) of aggravated burglary.

On 18 May 2020, over 30 suspected Patriotic Front supporters attacked Iso FM station in Isoka (Muchinga) throwing a container with an unknown gas into the studio as a live phone program was being aired. They demanded that the Live interview with the UPND Party president Hakainde Hichilema be stopped. [size=over 30]

On 1 May 2021, a self-proclaimed PF commander was assaulted and seriously injured by other PF members (allegedly from a rival faction) after he forced his way into the PF secretariat using a car in Lusaka (Lusaka, Lusaka). With the arrival of the police at the scene, members of the PF pelted stones at officers, also landing on journalists. A police officer and 2 journalists were injured, and a police car and the victim's vehicle were destroyed. 5 people were arrested. [size=no report]
